intro: Coronopus integrifolius, commonly known as the smoothleaf coronopus, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and simple, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth along the edges. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white in color and appear in early spring. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks.
